generatedPrompts.frontCover: a humorous and charming watercolor painting of a cartoon-style John, a man with glasses and a slightly bewildered expression, precariously balancing a giant, wobbly stack of birthday presents that towers over him. The presents are wrapped in mismatched, brightly colored paper with quirky patterns. One or two small gifts are comically falling off the stack mid-air. In the center of the card, written in beautiful, readable, flowing black handwritten cursive script, is the text "happy birthday". The entire scene is rendered in a soft, flowing watercolor style with visible artistic brush strokes, organic paint bleeds, and a subtle paper texture, creating a lighthearted, flat 2D artwork perfect for a greeting card.

The presents are wrapped in mismatched, brightly colored paper with quirky patterns. One or two small gifts are comically falling off the stack mid-air. In the center of the card, written in beautiful, readable, flowing black handwritten cursive script, is the text "happy birthday". The entire scene is rendered in a soft, flowing watercolor style with visible artistic brush strokes, organic paint bleeds, and a subtle paper texture, creating a lighthearted, flat 2D artwork perfect for a greeting card.". 
    
Use only 20% visual density - perhaps a single small element, subtle corner detail, or soft color gradient. Most of the back should be clean, peaceful space. Think elegant minimalism. IMPORTANT: DO NOT include any people, characters, figures, text, words, or greeting messages. NO TEXT AT ALL - only minimal decorative elements. in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds - Flat 2D artwork for printing
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges

generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Create a right interior page where this message is the absolute star: "John, happy birthday! I was going to make a joke about you getting older, but I decided to be nice since you're at an age where you might forget it by tomorrow anyway. Hope you have a fantastic day!". 

Use subtle style elements from the front design but keep decoration minimal (10-20% of page). Extract color hints from: "a humorous and charming watercolor painting of a cartoon-style John, a man with glasses and a slightly bewildered expression, precariously balancing a giant, wobbly stack of birthday presents that towers over him. The presents are wrapped in mismatched, brightly colored paper with quirky patterns. One or two small gifts are comically falling off the stack mid-air. In the center of the card, written in beautiful, readable, flowing black handwritten cursive script, is the text "happy birthday". The entire scene is rendered in a soft, flowing watercolor style with visible artistic brush strokes, organic paint bleeds, and a subtle paper texture, creating a lighthearted, flat 2D artwork perfect for a greeting card.".

- EXACT TEXT REPRODUCTION: The message text must be reproduced EXACTLY as written - every word, punctuation mark, and character must be perfect
- PUT TEXT IN QUOTES: Always enclose the message text in double quotes to make it clear this is literal text to be rendered exactly
- CRYSTAL CLEAR LEGIBILITY: The handwriting must be extremely readable - prioritize clarity over artistic flourishes
- NO SPELLING ERRORS: Every word must be spelled correctly exactly as provided
- PROPER SPACING: Use appropriate letter spacing, word spacing, and line spacing for easy reading
- CONTRAST: Ensure high contrast between text and background for maximum readability
- SIZE: Make text large enough to read easily - avoid cramped or tiny text
- COMPLETE MESSAGE: Include the ENTIRE message text - do not truncate, abbreviate, or omit any part
- Use beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal
- Position the message text in the optimal location for readability (center area, avoid top/bottom 10%) 

Think premium stationery - mostly white space, perfect message placement, and just a touch of elegant decoration (corner details, small flourish, or soft wash). The message should dominate the visual hierarchy. NO PEOPLE, NO CHARACTERS, NO FIGURES. in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds - Flat 2D artwork for printing
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
